column1: .@PuritanUSA has been awarded $11.6 million to increase production of COVID-19 testing swabs in Pittsfield by three million per month. I'm proud of the Mainers who've been involved in this manufacturing effort that is so critical to our nation’s health.  https://t.co/kdHPhwyor6

Nearly $50 million has been awarded to Maine farmers to help offset the harm they've experienced due to COVID-19. I worked to secure this funding for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program in the CARES Act. Applications will be accepted through Dec. 11: https://t.co/3cFqDvM1VP https://t.co/8LQ9lxdhXc

The COVID-19 pandemic is taking a severe toll on our small businesses the engine of our economy. In addition to pushing for a second-round of PPP I support expanded relief measures under SBA’s 7(a) loan program. https://t.co/bqLiY18hjn

Maine nursing homes will receive nearly $250000 in new federal funding to help prevent and reduce the spread of COVID-19 bringing the total to $10.6 million to date. This funding will help protect the health of nursing home residents and the hardworking staff who care for them.

Telehealth is an important service that allows physicians to treat patients while they are safely in their own homes. A nearly $1 million grant for MaineHealth will help expand telehealth infrastructure at rural hospitals and practices amid COVID-19.

Nearly $41 million has been awarded to help offset the financial harm Maine farmers have experienced amid COVID-19. I worked to secure this funding for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program & extend the deadline. Farmers have until Dec. 11 to apply: https://t.co/bAhpAa8sKH

⚠️ A new scam involves criminals claiming to be contact tracers & demanding that victims provide financial info to purchase a COVID-19 test kit. Anyone who receives this type of call should hang up & report it to @SenateAging's Fraud Hotline: 855-303-9470  https://t.co/3BrvX68HJw

COVID-19 has further underscored the importance of home health services & telehealth. @SenatorCardin & I introduced a bill to allow home health agencies to receive Medicare reimbursement for audio & video telehealth services during public health crises.  https://t.co/qxL2mnBGhn

I’ve secured $450+ million in COVID-19 relief for Maine’s medical providers but reporting changes could claw back some funding from rural hospitals nursing homes & other providers nationwide. I joined a bipartisan group calling on HHS to reconsider.  https://t.co/NtKmnzvGp5

The pandemic & drought have created severe challenges for Maine farmers. I advocated for the $35 million Maine farmers received to date in COVID-19 relief & USDA’s drought disaster declaration will provide additional support.    https://t.co/lih1NNAkn0

PPP is the result of a bipartisan commitment to support our small businesses nonprofits & jobs amid COVID-19. From the Senate floor I urged my colleagues to pass a measure @marcorubio & I authored to allow the hardest-hit small businesses to receive a 2nd forgivable PPP loan. https://t.co/mF0WOuaCng

I toured Bar Harbor Foods in Whiting & spoke with the company’s dedicated employees. As a leading producer of seafood products @barharborfoods exemplifies the Maine spirit of hard work. I will continue to support our seafood processors and fisheries amid COVID-19. https://t.co/IkWe4TRT3O

I joined the start of an exciting project between Puritan & Cianbro that will provide a boost in our fight against COVID-19. A new facility funded by a $51.2 million federal grant will increase COVID-19 test swabs by 50 million/month & create 200 manufacturing jobs in Pittsfield. https://t.co/m4t3v3MB1f

In order to continue to protect health care workers & help mitigate the spread of COVID-19 Maine has been awarded nearly $2.3 million to purchase additional PPE. As we combat this ongoing pandemic it’s imperative that we keep those on the frontline safe. https://t.co/CYsADQNPwf

The closure of the U.S.-Canada border to all but essential travel despite the apparent low risk of cross-border COVID-19 transmission has harmed many families & small businesses. That’s why Maine’s & NH’s U.S. Senators urged the Administration to reevaluate these restrictions. https://t.co/xR9hXGKKuq

An additional $20 billion is available for medical providers to help fight COVID-19 & protect our communities. Maine hospitals rural health clinics assisted living facilities mental health & addiction services & others can begin applying today at https://t.co/7SbDUbSnj2

Keeping people affordably & stably housed amid COVID-19 while not bankrupting small property owners is both a moral imperative & a public health necessity. The Administration must prioritize coupling the eviction moratorium with rental assistance.  https://t.co/rUq034hSsP

I have tested negative for COVID. Although I had almost no contact with my three colleagues who have tested positive I thought it prudent to get tested.  My thoughts are with the President FLOTUS my colleagues & all who are infected.

With assistance from federal programs that I've championed—including BUILD & PPP—Waterville’s revitalization has been a catalyst for job creation. I'll continue to fight for programs that support Maine’s small businesses & that assist communities as we battle COVID-19.

York Rotary’s response to the pandemic is a great example of how Rotarians give back. Their volunteer efforts have included meal delivery service which has been vital to seniors & families. I attended their meeting to provide an update on our work to combat COVID-19. https://t.co/Z9Muyb6aDH

I spoke with Maine adult education leaders about the need to support our students amid COVID-19. It’s crucial that Mainers have access to the proper tools & resources to help them achieve their goals as they enter the workforce & I'll continue to advocate for them in the Senate. https://t.co/GZIx0JXLrV

Far too many lifesaving medications are manufactured overseas. I pressed the FDA Commissioner on the steps being taken to ensure that more medications such as future COVID-19 therapeutics and vaccines will be manufactured right here in the U.S.   https://t.co/rHp0eB3sxA

More than $1.4 million has been awarded to support the growth of biomedical technology & food service industries in Kennebec & Cumberland counties to help offset the financial harm caused by COVID-19.  https://t.co/SlZPQ2ZRef

At a Senate Health Committee hearing this morning I called on top officials from HHS and FDA to ensure they are following their institutions’ rigorous gold standard protocols as researchers develop vaccines & treatments to fight COVID-19. https://t.co/RGK6qlOzcG

Maine’s timber harvesting & hauling businesses have suffered financial harm amid COVID-19. As the author of the Loggers Relief Act I led a bipartisan group in urging @USDA to include these workers in the federal government’s COVID-19 response & provide them w/ financial relief. https://t.co/RUxAVBlluy

COVID-19 is taking a severe toll on jobs & small businesses in the bus & passenger ferry industries. @SenJackReed & I led a group of 26 Senators calling for our bipartisan CERTS Act to be included in the next COVID-19 package to support these essential transportation services. https://t.co/ce2eC8knSE

Maine has received more than $6.6 million to support affordable housing assist businesses & strengthen our COVID-19 response. This is in addition to the $20.8 million Maine received earlier this year as part of funding I included in the CARES Act.  https://t.co/llcSNr54tm

USDA has expanded the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program that was created by the CARES Act. To date more than $25 million has been awarded to Maine farmers. I encourage all farmers who have been harmed by reduced demand & prices amid COVID-19 to apply: https://t.co/bAhpAa8sKH

This afternoon Bishop Robert Deeley celebrated the annual Blue Mass in Portland to bless all law enforcement officers firefighters & other emergency personnel. This year’s Mass was particularly moving as we prayed for those who are on the front lines amid COVID-19. https://t.co/VuOA8Ucluu

I spoke with Maine members of @ASCO about the pandemic's impact on their dedicated efforts to improve care for those with cancer. To avoid delays to research being done in Maine & across the U.S. I'll continue to advocate for COVID-19 relief funding for our research communities. https://t.co/2IHWicmOsL

As we continue to work to safely reopen our communities it’s crucial that we accurately track COVID-19. That’s why I joined a bipartisan group of colleagues in urging the CDC & HHS to modernize automate & streamline data collection efforts.  https://t.co/eK4mxYlmdx

As we combat the COVID-19 pandemic it’s critical that we continue to support first responders who are on the front lines. York County Sheriff’s Office has received $111603 to expand mental health & wellness resources for law enforcement officers.  https://t.co/J5C497aB0r

Northern New England Passenger Rail Authority—which serves the Downeaster—has received more than $2.1 million to assist with maintenance costs. Rail systems are facing increased financial pressures amid COVID-19 & this funding will help improve safety efficiency & reliability. https://t.co/mEHKaEqgsJ

More than $25 million has been awarded to Maine farmers to help offset the financial harm they have experienced due to the pandemic. I worked to secure this funding for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) in the CARES Act.  https://t.co/rZRDcWuEiR

Changes made to the Organic Certification Cost Share Program would cause Maine organic farmers to lose more than $122000 in 2020 on top of COVID-19-related losses. USDA must reverse the changes to OCCSP which helps farmers enter the organic marketplace  https://t.co/nVchYRX0GK https://t.co/0IapwuDr70

Casco Bay Lines received $1.9 million through the CARES Act to ensure that this essential service is available for island residents amid COVID-19. As Chairman of the Transportation Appropriations Subcommittee I wrote the bill that provided this funding.  https://t.co/RWkfOA2ELY

I questioned the @NIHDirector about the importance of ensuring rural hospitals have equal access to a COVID-19 vaccine & the equipment needed to store & administer it. It's critical that hospitals like those that are part of Northern Light Health have access to these resources. https://t.co/6CeCOfqoE4
Nearly $4 million has been awarded to 18 Maine Health Centers to increase COVID-19 testing acquire medical supplies and boost telehealth capacity to respond to the pandemic.  https://t.co/sJzevNHDBn

As Chairman of @SenateAging I urged HHS to make assisted living facilities eligible for the Provider Relief Fund helping to protect the health of residents and staff of senior living communities amid COVID-19. Assisted living facilities have until Sept. 13 to apply. https://t.co/0RfbfOjqJU

I met with Skowhegan small business owners & their employees who've worked hard to keep their doors open amid COVID-19 & safely serve the community. It was great to hear how the Paycheck Protection Program is helping to provide support. https://t.co/GXJmcTZra8

I visited Volk Packaging in Biddeford which is helping Maine businesses that are distributing supplies needed to fight COVID-19. Volk’s employees define the Maine spirit of resilience & I’m pleased the PPP helped support the jobs of these hardworking Mainers. https://t.co/6zuU179dhk

STARC Systems in Brunswick has manufactured containment systems that help keep patients & medical professionals safe amid COVID-19. I’m pleased the PPP helped support the jobs of these hardworking & innovative employees & I'll continue to support them every step of the way. https://t.co/FAIYVNG7MT

We must continue to support our farmers during the current public health and economic crisis. That’s why I joined my colleagues in advocating for the inclusion of additional relief for agriculture in future COVID-19 response legislation. https://t.co/nRKCWAZsyJ

Maine health care organizations have received $7.5 million to assist Mainers struggling with substance use disorder. While we continue to fight COVID-19 we must not relent in addressing the ongoing opioid crisis which affects far too many Maine families  https://t.co/DrOcZ4nSLr

$10.4 million has been awarded to nursing homes & skilled nursing facilities throughout Maine. This funding will help protect the health of nursing home residents prevent & reduce the spread of COVID-19 & support our health care providers.  https://t.co/bnl99WQ8iD

Abbott Labs which employs hundreds of Mainers at its facility in Scarborough is leading the way in our fight against COVID-19! This low-cost COVID-19 test—which produces results in 15 minutes—will help save American lives. https://t.co/Pi6qPsBSzn

UPDATE: More than $22 million has been awarded to Maine farmers. This important funding was provided through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program which I worked to include in the CARES Act & will help offset the financial harm farmers have experienced https://t.co/gp13WHVr0G

Thank you to all of the volunteers employees & members of the Maine National Guard for supporting York Hospital’s Drive-Thru Rapid Result COVID-19 Testing Center!  These critical efforts are making a real difference in helping to stop the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/v1TIQ4jWMG

I had wonderful discussions w/ South Berwick small business owners & their employees who've worked hard to keep their doors open amid COVID-19 & safely serve locals. The PPP I co-authored has provided forgivable loans to more than 28000 Maine small businesses. https://t.co/zMKODslYOT

Maine Fire Departments have received more than $1.3 million to upgrade equipment & protective gear through the grant program I helped create. This funding will ensure that the brave firefighters remain safe & healthy amid COVID-19.  https://t.co/Lg0ikolL1L

I appreciate the strong support of the American Postal Workers Union AFL-CIO for the bill @SenFeinstein & I introduced on July 2 that would provide USPS up to $25 billion for COVID-19 relief. Congress must pass our bill quickly to support the critical service USPS delivers. https://t.co/9cidmvvt9M

Congress must quickly take up and pass the Postal Service Emergency Assistance Act—legislation I introduced with @SenFeinstein on July 2nd—which would provide the USPS with up to $25 billion to cover revenue losses or operational expenses resulting from COVID-19. https://t.co/ysa4oauMLG

The Bangor Letter Shop is committed to supporting local businesses giving back to the community & strengthening the local economy. I'm pleased that a forgivable PPP loan helped keep their dedicated employees paid & cover rent amid the economic crisis caused by COVID-19. https://t.co/70eFp2hvU7

Nearly $20 million in COVID-19 financial relief has now been awarded to Maine farmers. These direct payments which I worked to include in the CARES Act will help offset the financial harm Maine’s farming communities have experienced due to the pandemic.  https://t.co/MdGfdpqE78

I called on PMG DeJoy to rescind the policies causing unacceptable delays in mail delivery & he has now done so. Next Congress must pass the bill @SenFeinstein & I intro’d on July 2 to provide USPS up to $25B in emergency funding for COVID-19 relief.  https://t.co/6CHOJnMbJ1

We cannot shortchange service to the public to fix USPS' financial issues. The Postmaster General must take immediate action to remedy these delays & Congress must pass the bill @SenFeinstein & I introduced on July 2 that would provide USPS up to $25 billion for COVID-19 relief.

The Senate should return this week to consider a COVID-19 package that includes the Postal Service Emergency Assistance Act—a bill I introduced w/ @SenFeinstein in July—which would provide USPS w/ up to $25 billion to cover losses or operational expenses resulting from COVID-19.

More than $1.2 million has been awarded to public transportation systems in the Bangor & Portland regions to purchase buses & make improvements along their routes.  This investment will help keep public transit safe and reliable amid COVID-19.  https://t.co/SQMTtl2b7p

Maine received more than $2.2 million to support affordable housing and bolster COVID-19 response efforts. As the Chairman of the Housing Appropriations Subcommittee I am working to deliver these critical resources to our communities.  https://t.co/7KpYgmOmh6

1 in 4 young adults say they’ve considered suicide in the past month due to COVID-19. @SenCapito & I introduced an amendment to increase funding for SAMHSA by $4.5 billion in the next COVID-19 package. If you or a loved one needs help please contact 1-800-662-HELP (4357).

The Houlton Band of Maliseet Indians has been awarded $900000 to expand an existing food service facility helping to ensure tribal members can safely access affordable and nutritious food services during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/Lf4bvmJFjG

.@PuritanUSA has been awarded $51.2 million to expand its COVID-19 testing swab production to 90 million per month.  This investment will significantly boost testing efforts that will help us to safely reopen our communities.  https://t.co/CUWZhsqF4Y

The USPS continues to be a lifeline amid COVID-19 especially for seniors veterans & those in rural areas who rely on mail delivery for essential goods. I sent a letter calling for the USPS to promptly address the delays in mail delivery.  https://t.co/ltoeWRBttM https://t.co/k6Y6cEHAvH

I held a @SenateAging hearing on the disparate impact of COVID-19 & steps that we can take to support community partnerships & culturally & linguistically appropriate services for immigrant communities. Fatuma provided helpful expertise & insight in preparation for that hearing.

I met with Fatuma Hussein Executive Director of @ircofme to discuss Maine’s racial disparity in COVID-19 cases how we can address it & how we can continue to work together to help all Mainers have access to the education & resources they need to achieve their full potential. https://t.co/vC3MSIlTCj

At Strainrite in Auburn I answered questions from employees & provided an update on the federal government’s response to COVID-19. As an employee-owned manufacturing company Strainrite exemplifies Maine’s entrepreneurial spirit. The PPP is helping to sustain this small business https://t.co/RnopxCQkki

Blackie’s Farm Fresh Produce is a staple in Auburn working with local farmers to provide Mainers with access to fresh produce. I’m thrilled that a forgivable PPP loan helped Blackie’s owner Matt Manson to continue paying his staff despite disruptions due to COVID-19. https://t.co/xzOxBaPgjo

Maine families & small businesses have experienced economic hardships due to increased costs of imported foods. @SenatorMenendez & I led a bipartisan group urging the @ustraderep to end the 25% tariff & stop subjecting Maine to further harm amid COVID-19.  https://t.co/R2hFiK9WIA

Great news! Maple syrup producers are now eligible for financial relief following advocacy by the Maine Delegation & @GovJanetMills. This will help offset revenue losses from the cancellation of Maine Maple Sunday & market disruptions due to COVID-19.  https://t.co/X35rkH1IXr

Thank you @AlzImpact! Your advocacy and leadership make such a difference for our seniors. Congress must provide more funding for OAA programs like home-delivered meals in the next COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/fWN2FlTBEf
My full statement on the Executive Orders to provide COVID-19 relief: https://t.co/VUPJ1yUcoI https://t.co/uP6zgFF5Tp

Helping first generation & low-income Maine families achieve higher education has long been a priority of mine. This $5 million in federal funding for TRIO programs at 13 Maine colleges & universities will help support students who are facing increasing challenges amid COVID-19. https://t.co/CJuALrajsk

COVID-19 has greatly affected America’s bus motorcoach & passenger ferry industries. @SenJackReed & I introduced a bill to provide $10 billion in emergency grants to help keep these critical links in our transportation system strong. The Senate should pass this bill immediately

NEW FUNDING: More than $5 million has been awarded to 13 Maine colleges & universities to support federal TRIO Programs. This funding will help low-income & first-generation college students continue to achieve their academic & career goals amid COVID-19.  https://t.co/hKmOJ9tbws

Maine’s lobstermen & women have been careful stewards of our natural resources for generations. This is an extremely unfair decision at an already challenging time for Maine's lobster industry that is facing reduced sales & exports due to COVID-19.  https://t.co/oEDExoC3t6

Maine has received an additional $2.6 million to support its ongoing response to COVID-19. This funding will support our public health professionals’ efforts to expand testing capacities improve contact tracing & enhance containment efforts.  https://t.co/fCHQJR9csf

This is what they’re doing already; it's only going to get worse for our towns & cities as revenues continue to plummet. Congress must act to provide direct assistance to every community. This is a problem we can solve. Let’s enact the SMART Act in the next COVID-19 package.

Through the CARES Act Maine has received more than $44 million to support K-12 education. The next COVID-19 relief package must include funding to help school districts implement necessary safety precautions.

I spoke w/ Eileen King of the Maine School Superintendents Association as well as Superintendents from Oxford Hills; Caribou Stockholm & Fort Fairfield; Gorham; & Biddeford about the steps they're taking to promote school safety & support students' academic goals amid COVID-19. https://t.co/Phm3oMopVO

Students should have access to free meals amid COVID-19 regardless of whether in-school learning is available. @SenatorHassan & I led a group of 36 Senators urging USDA to support students and school meal programs through the next school year. https://t.co/5k2RlYTF6Y

I visited W.S. Emerson in Brewer today & spoke with employees about their transition to making up to 1200 masks per day which has helped preserve jobs & aided our response to COVID-19. These dedicated Mainers are making a meaningful impact on the community. https://t.co/AvmtY5fmkG

.@PortCityPCMH has made countless contributions to Portland’s vibrant live music scene. Its closure underscores the need to pass the Save Our Stages Act a bill I cosponsored to provide targeted financial relief for small entertainment venues amid COVID-19 https://t.co/J057mMYRd4

Earlier this year Congress boosted unemployment benefits to assist Americans who lost their jobs amid COVID-19. As we debate additional relief we must avoid a sharp drop in benefits that would cause further harm to struggling families.  https://t.co/a3yPfefhd8

Community Clinical Services has been awarded nearly $330000 to expand COVID-19 testing & tracing in Androscoggin & Cumberland counties. This funding provided through COVID-19 relief will support the health center’s efforts to care for seniors & families https://t.co/OkrPeOIDxY

NEW FUNDING: Nearly $17 million has been awarded to help Maine educators become “Education Engineers” as they improve remote learning for K-12 students amid COVID-19. I advocated for this funding that will help students continue to achieve their goals.  https://t.co/3MsVrMTQvV

Maine farmers have now received nearly $9.5 million in COVID-19 financial relief. I worked to include this funding in the CARES Act to help farming communities during the pandemic. Farmers can apply through August 28.  https://t.co/kn6SJk2foj

The child abuse & neglect crisis happening across the U.S. has been exacerbated by COVID-19. To help improve our ability to reach those in need I introduced a bill with @SenatorSinema that would provide federal funding for the National Child Abuse Hotline https://t.co/l91hpgLfmF

Thank you for inviting me to speak with you! It was a pleasure to join your roundtable to discuss how national service programs are helping our communities during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/UbD1Lpaw7g

To assist small businesses & their employees that have been hit the hardest by COVID-19 I authored a bill with @MarcoRubio that would allow them to receive a second forgivable PPP loan & help them purchase equipment to keep customers & employees safe.  https://t.co/NqWJjlgj5e https://t.co/URo8Qjd0zO

The South Portland Bus Service received more than $700000 to help cover expenses & continue to provide key transit services for Mainers amid COVID-19. This funding was provided through a provision of the CARES Act I authored.  https://t.co/zgMMCfkwzJ

Maine's forest products industry sustains rural communities & jobs but it has suffered significant loses as a result of COVID-19. I joined @RepGolden in introducing a bill to provide critical financial assistance to Maine's family logging businesses that harvest & haul timber. https://t.co/OCzSIcU4Ca
Clean energy is a source of good-paying jobs in Maine & across the U.S. The next COVID-19 relief package should support this sector to promote job creation & innovation.  https://t.co/SFCkZOtfC1

I was delighted to be in Van Buren to celebrate a $2.14 million federal contract awarded to Maine Farmers Exchange for the purchase of Maine farm products. Maine was originally left out of this program that supports farmers & families who are facing hardships due to COVID-19. https://t.co/YIQof4o7cr

I joined the @napshq podcast to discuss a bill @SenFeinstein & I authored that would provide USPS with emergency financial relief during the pandemic & help keep its employees safe. COVID-19 has changed our daily lives & USPS is needed now more than ever. https://t.co/wNS68ScvT3

Black & Latino Americans are infected with COVID-19 at three times the rate of their white neighbors & they're nearly twice as likely to die from it. To better understand this disparity—& how we can work to reduce it—I chaired the first Senate hearing on this important issue. https://t.co/8G5H6HD0jb

As the Chairman of the Transportation Appropriations Subcommittee I recently secured $38.1 million to replace & rehabilitate seven bridges across five communities & four counties. Read my column about how this will create much-needed jobs amid COVID-19.  https://t.co/NmSTnmVWpW

WATCH LIVE: I am chairing a @SenateAging hearing focused on addressing racial health disparities among seniors during the COVID-19 pandemic. Health care leaders & researchers will speak about COVID-19’s disparate health impacts.  https://t.co/xMFE9QLM8z

Maine’s buses & ferries create good jobs & are relied upon by schools camps tour groups & island residents. COVID-19 has taken a severe toll on these small businesses. A bill @SenJackReed & I authored would provide $10 billion to help them get through this difficult period. https://t.co/SoPuDaQMvF

Maine hospitals will receive more than $1.1 million to support ongoing efforts to combat COVID-19. This funding will be used to expand telemedicine procure critical equipment & streamline facility coordination efforts.  https://t.co/7UXDXxPWF4

I spoke with leaders of Allen’s Blueberry Freezer & Wyman’s about COVID-19's effect on Maine’s blueberry industry. Their success depends on the hard work of our blueberry farmers whom I worked to ensure are eligible for $16 billion in agricultural aid provided by the CARES Act. https://t.co/2l88MKRNKo

This afternoon @NoLabelsOrg’s bipartisan bicameral Members of Congress met with @stevenmnuchin1 to discuss the next COVID-19 package including economic relief and aid to state and local governments. @Sen_JoeManchin and I are the Senate chairs of No Labels. https://t.co/q4EaRC1u2w

We should extend & expand the current medical expense deduction as part of the next COVID-19 relief package. This deduction is an important relief tool for the high health care costs that burden many Americans. https://t.co/MBue6noqtA

Amid COVID-19 working studying & receiving health care online have been difficult for those with limited or no broadband access. @Sen_JoeManchin & I authored a bill to create a program to provide Internet hotspot devices in rural & low-income areas.  https://t.co/nndHlekl3l.

I met with Jenna Mehnert CEO of @NAMIMaine to discuss ways to combat the mental health challenges that COVID-19 has exacerbated including funding for crisis intervention and supports for families and children adjusting to remote learning.

I spoke with members of Maine Preservation about ways we can strengthen the Historic Tax Credit which supports projects that revitalize communities & boost economic development. To help manage delays caused by COVID-19 I urged Treasury to extend deadlines related to the HTC. https://t.co/h2u0M41AeY

When a COVID-19 vaccine becomes available all Americans—regardless of age race income or location—must be able to access it. @SenJackReed & I are calling for at least $5.6 billion in the next relief package to support vaccine distribution.  https://t.co/KhvGiooCrL

I visited Moody’s Collision Center in Gorham to meet with employees & provide an update on our response to COVID-19. From making face masks to taking extra precautions Moody’s has stepped up to meet the challenge. They also received a forgivable loan through the PPP. https://t.co/VHlLxDwo7J

An additional $1.6 million has been awarded to support the revitalization of Maine small businesses that have suffered financial harm due to COVID-19. I worked to secure this funding in the CARES Act & I'll continue to advocate for Maine’s communities. https://t.co/SaUlu2ATma

Great news! The Administration rescinded its visa rule that would've jeopardized international students' education & harmed colleges & universities including in Maine. I called for the rescission of this unfair policy that penalized students taking online classes due to COVID-19

These food boxes were made possible through a $1.35 million USDA grant. Maine was initially left out of this program that supports local farmers & families facing hardships due to COVID-19. The Maine Delegation successfully urged the USDA to include our state. https://t.co/dt13WHPAbs

An unemployment insurance fraud ring has been targeting Maine & other states stealing from taxpayers & delaying benefits for legitimate filers. I wrote to the DOL's IG seeking info on stopping these criminals who are exploiting COVID-19 for their own gain https://t.co/tRg4WTyO8l

Casco Bay Lines has been awarded more than $2.6 million in CARES Act funding to offset costs incurred as a result of COVID-19. This funding will help ensure that they can continue to provide safe & reliable transportation to those who live & work in our island communities. https://t.co/97H29vhq93

A new visa rule would jeopardize the education of nearly one million international students and harm hundreds of colleges and universities including in Maine. This policy must be rescinded to allow students to retain their visas if they attend classes online due to COVID-19. https://t.co/vGwxA1yvzh

I spoke with MSAD 6 leaders about the steps they are taking to keep their schools safe & help students continue to achieve their educational goals. The next COVID-19 relief package must include additional funds to help districts implement measures to protect school communities. https://t.co/K8mgFFeoQn

USPS employees face increased risks amid COVID-19. To help USPS cope with added costs to protect workers & declining first-class & marketing mail volumes @SenFeinstein & I authored a bill to provide up to $25 billion to offset COVID-19-related expenses.  https://t.co/3A3LrhD6Sb

Reducing drug costs is one of my top priorities particularly during COVID-19. I joined @ChuckGrassley in introducing a bill that would save Americans tens of billions of dollars by creating penalties for drug manufacturers & middlemen who drive up prices. https://t.co/T10lLLF7Bs

$545000 has been awarded for infrastructure improvement projects at the Eastport & Wiscasset Municipal Airports. As Chairman of the Transportation Appropriations Subcommittee I'm committed to supporting our local airports & their workers amid COVID-19.  https://t.co/i2oXwXdlLi

NEW FUNDING: Maine farmers have been awarded $7.75 million to help offset the financial harm they have experienced due to COVID-19. These direct payments which I worked to include in the CARES Act will help provide relief to Maine’s farming communities.  https://t.co/FO7O1owyGU

The PPP has been a tremendous success helping support nearly 75% of small businesses in Maine & sustaining nearly 200000 Maine jobs. As the economic crisis caused by COVID-19 continues however millions of small employers need additional help to stay above water & survive. https://t.co/ePFJHw7fGN

I questioned Dr. Fauci about pool testing an efficient cost-effective way to help communities safely reopen. This strategy could help schools identify the presence of COVID-19 & protect students teachers staff & other employees.  https://t.co/N1GuxpaIC8

COVID-19 has had a disastrous effect on Maine's tourism industry. Increased testing is essential to safely reopening our state & protecting our health. I urged top health officials—including Dr. Fauci & ADM Giroir—to work with states to better align testing supplies with demand. https://t.co/7z5bFVYb05

At a Senate Health Committee hearing this morning I will question Dr. Fauci & other public health officials about the federal government’s ongoing COVID-19 response & efforts to help states safely reopen our communities & schools.  Click here to watch: https://t.co/JoghVTl7mr

I extend my deepest condolences to the family and friends of the Mainer who passed away from COVID-19.  A difficult road lies ahead for our state.  We are resilient and we will get through this crisis together.

An outbreak of COVID-19 at one of our nation’s shipyards or other large defense contractors risks the safety of the industrial base's primary asset—its skilled workforce—and could truly be devastating to our nation’s security.

Employees in the defense industry face unique challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic and the strain and stress on shipbuilders like the hardworking men and women at Bath Iron Works are without recent precedent.

The Senate just passed the $7.76 billion appropriations agreement to fight the coronavirus and fully restore funding for the vital LIHEAP program.  The bill now goes to the President’s desk to be signed into law.
UPDATE: Maine will receive at least $4.57 million to fight the coronavirus.

BREAKING: The Appropriations Committee on which I serve has reached an agreement to provide needed funding to fight the coronavirus.    As part of the agreement Congress will replenish $37.4 million of crucial LIHEAP funding that was previously diverted.

At a Senate Health Committee hearing on the coronavirus I pressed top officials from U.S. health agencies on ways to prevent drug shortages and protect Americans from the spread of the virus. https://t.co/6Xda3lJHHf

China accounts for 13 percent of the facilities making active pharmaceutical ingredients to supply the U.S. market.  The manufacturing disruptions caused by the coronavirus demonstrate why it is so important for FDA to have greater visibility into the drug supply chain.

In light of the first drug shortage due to the coronavirus I appreciated the efforts of 14 health organizations calling on the Health Committee to pass the MEDS Act. @SenTinaSmith & I authored this bill to help prevent shortages of vital medications. https://t.co/cFF4cZqx5V

The need to provide additional funding to fight the coronavirus is urgent but transferring money from the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) is the wrong approach and would hurt low-income families struggling to pay their heating bills.
